Questions are based on news reports in The Times this week. Answers appear on page 46.
1. This was drama on the high seas. What were the circumstances?

2. The high levels of ozone and acid rain that are normally associated with industrialization have been found for the first time over the virgin forests of Central Africa. What is causing the pollution?
3. In an unusual event, critics praised the performance of a pianist who recently appeared with the Philadelphia Orchestra. Identify him and explain.
4. The Supreme Court ruled in a 5-to-4 vote that no laws could prohibit political protesters from burning the American flag. What was unusual about how the Justices voted?
5. Gov. Mario M. Cuomo has begun a campaign for an alternative sentence to capital punishment in New York State. What is it?
6. The president of I.B.M. disclosed that the company has a surprising edge over Japan in a crucial area. What is it?
7. Curtis Strange accomplished something no one in his sport had achieved in 38 years. What was it?
8. ''For Sale'' signs have begun to sprout at small gasoline stations across the country. What is imperiling these mom and pop service stations?

9. Leaders around the world denounced the executions of people in Beijing for their role in violent anti-Government protests earlier this month. What was noteworthy about the protesters the Government selected to be put to death?

10. After some unusual training, the Boston Bruins ended a 45-year losing streak in 1988, defeating the Montreal Canadiens in the playoff series 4 games to 1. What kind of training did the team undergo?
11. A murder mystery is gripping Austin, Tex.: Who would kill a tree? Explain.
12. At a meeting in Zaire, leaders of the Angolan Government and rebel forces agreed to a cease-fire in their 14-year war. What was the impetus for the accord?
13. Pete Rose, the besieged manager of the Cincinnati Reds, hopes to succeed where team owners like George Steinbrenner, Charlie Finley, Ted Turner and Phil Ball have failed. Explain.
14. The Federal Aviation Administration has begun an ambitious program to bolster the ranks of the air traffic controllers working the nation's business air corridors. What is it?

15. Talks on strategic nuclear weapons resumed in Geneva, but for the first time in 20 years, they are no longer the top American arms control priority. What subject now is at the top of the American agenda?
16. In recent years, a sports sideline has transcended sports, turning into a $3 billion market that has enriched college and pro teams. What is the source of the revenue?
